title: Job 1:1
content: 1 There was a man in the land of Uz. Job was his name, and that man was blameless and righteous, both fearful of God and turning from evil.

title: Job 1:2
content: 2 Seven sons and three daughters were born to him.

title: Job 1:3
content: 3 And his stock was 7, 000 sheep and 3, 000 camels and 500 pairs of oxen and 500 donkeys and a very large retinue. And that man was greater than all the sons of the East.

title: Job 1:4
content: 4 And his sons went and made a feast, a man in {his} house on his day, and they sent and called their three sisters to eat and to drink with them.

title: Job 1:5
content: 5 And it happened that when the days of the feast had gone around, Job sent and consecrated them. He arose early in the morning and offered burnt offerings {according to} the number of all of them. For Job said, “Perhaps my sons have sinned and blessed God in their hearts.” Thus Job did all the days.

title: Job 1:6
content: 6 And it was the day, and the sons of God came to present themselves to Yahweh. And the adversary also came in the midst of them.

title: Job 1:7
content: 7 And Yahweh said to the adversary, “From where have you come?” And the adversary answered Yahweh and said, “From wandering on the earth and from going back and forth on it.”

title: Job 1:8
content: 8 And Yahweh said to the adversary, “Have you set your heart upon my servant Job? For {there is} not like him on the earth, a blameless and righteous man, fearful of God and turning from evil.”

title: Job 1:9
content: 9 And the adversary answered Yahweh and said, “Does Job fear God for nothing?

title: Job 1:10
content: 10 Have you not put a hedge around him and around his house and around all that {is} his, from every side? You have blessed the works of his hands, and his cattle have burst forth in the land.

title: Job 1:11
content: 11 However, just stretch out your hand and touch all that {is} his, if he will not bless you to your face.”

title: Job 1:12
content: 12 And Yahweh said to the adversary, “Behold, all that {is} his {is} in your hand. Only against him do not stretch out your hand.” And the adversary went away from the face of Yahweh.

title: Job 1:13
content: 13 And it was the day, and his sons and his daughters {were} eating and drinking wine in the house of their eldest brother.

title: Job 1:14
content: 14 And a messenger came to Job and said, “The oxen were plowing and the donkeys {were} feeding at their hand.

title: Job 1:15
content: 15 And Sheba fell {on them} and took them, and they struck the servants with the edge of the sword, and only I alone have escaped to tell you.”

title: Job 1:16
content: 16 That one {was} still speaking and another came and said, “The fire of God fell from the heavens and burned up the sheep and the servants and consumed them, and only I alone have escaped to tell you.”

title: Job 1:17
content: 17 That one {was} still speaking and another came and said, “The Chaldeans formed three groups and rushed against the camels and took them, and they struck the servants with the edge of the sword, and only I alone have escaped to tell you.”

title: Job 1:18
content: 18 That one {was} still speaking and another came and said, “Your sons and your daughters {were} eating and drinking wine in the house of their eldest brother.

title: Job 1:19
content: 19 And behold, a great wind came from across the desert and struck the four corners of the house, and it fell on the young people and they died, and only I alone have escaped to tell you.”

title: Job 1:20
content: 20 And Job arose and tore his robe and shaved his head and fell to the ground and prostrated himself.

title: Job 1:21
content: 21 And he said, “Naked I came from the womb of my mother, and naked I will return there. Yahweh gave, and Yahweh has taken. May the name of Yahweh be blessed.”

title: Job 1:22
content: 22 In all of this, Job did not sin and he did not ascribe impropriety to God.

title: Job 2:1
content: 1 And it was the day, and the sons of God came to present themselves to Yahweh, and the adversary also came in their midst to present himself to Yahweh.

title: Job 2:2
content: 2 And Yahweh said to the adversary, “From where have you come?” And the adversary answered Yahweh and said, “From wandering on the earth and from going back and forth on it.”

title: Job 2:3
content: 3 And Yahweh said to the adversary, “Have you set your heart on my servant Job? For there is not like him on the earth, a blameless and righteous man, fearful of God and turning from evil. And still he is holding firmly to his integrity, although you incited me against him, to devour him for nothing.”

title: Job 2:4
content: 4 And the adversary answered Yahweh and said, “Skin for skin! Indeed, all that {is} to a man, he will give for his life.

title: Job 2:5
content: 5 However, just stretch out your hand and touch upon his bones and upon his flesh, if he will not bless you to your face.”

title: Job 2:6
content: 6 And Yahweh said to the adversary, “Behold him in your hand; only spare his life.”

title: Job 2:7
content: 7 And the adversary went away from the face of Yahweh, and he struck Job with bad boils from the sole of his foot to his pate.

title: Job 2:8
content: 8 And he took for himself a shard to scrape himself with it, and he was sitting in the midst of the ash pile.

title: Job 2:9
content: 9 And his wife said to him, “{Are} you still holding firmly to your integrity? Bless God and die.”

title: Job 2:10
content: 10 But he said to her, “Like the speaking of the foolish one, you are speaking. Indeed, will we receive the good from God and not receive the bad?” In all of this, Job did not sin with his lips.

title: Job 2:11
content: 11 And the three friends of Job heard {that} all this evil had come on him, and they each came from his place, Eliphaz the Temanite and Bildad the Shuhite and Zophar the Naamathite, and they gathered together to come to sympathize with him and to comfort him.

title: Job 2:12
content: 12 And they raised their eyes from afar and they did not recognize him, and they raised their voice and wept, and they each tore his robe, and they threw dust heavenward upon their heads.

title: Job 2:13
content: 13 And they sat with him on the ground for seven days and seven nights, and {there was} no speaking a word to him, for they saw that {his} grief was very great.

title: Job 3:1
content: 1 After this, Job opened his mouth and cursed his day.

title: Job 3:2
content: 2 Job answered and said,

title: Job 3:3
content: 3 “May the day on which I was born perish, and the night {that} said, ‘A boy has been conceived.’

title: Job 3:4
content: 4 That day—may it be dark! May God not seek it from above, and may light not shine upon it.

title: Job 3:5
content: 5 May darkness and a dark shadow claim it; may a cloud dwell over it; may the blacknesses of the day terrify it.

title: Job 3:6
content: 6 That night—may gloom take it! May it not rejoice among the days of the year; into the number of the months may it not come.

title: Job 3:7
content: 7 Behold: That night—may it be barren! May a joyful shout not come into it.

title: Job 3:8
content: 8 May the ones cursing a day curse it, the ones skillful to awaken Leviathan.

title: Job 3:9
content: 9 May the stars of its twilight be dark; may it wait for light but {there be} none, and may it not see the eyelids of the dawn,

title: Job 3:10
content: 10 because it did not close the doors of my womb and hide trouble from my eyes.

title: Job 3:11
content: 11 Why did I not die from the womb, come out of the belly and expire?

title: Job 3:12
content: 12 Why did knees welcome me, and why breasts, that I should suck?

title: Job 3:13
content: 13 For now I had lain down and was reposing, I had slept, then it was being rest to me

title: Job 3:14
content: 14 with kings and counselors of the earth, the ones having built monuments for themselves,

title: Job 3:15
content: 15 or with princes, gold {having been} to them, the ones having filled their houses with silver.

title: Job 3:16
content: 16 Or, like a hidden stillborn child, I might not have been, as infants {sometimes} do not see the light.

title: Job 3:17
content: 17 There the wicked stop troubling, and there the weary in strength rest.

title: Job 3:18
content: 18 Captives relax together; they do not hear the voice of a taskmaster.

title: Job 3:19
content: 19 Small and great {are} there the same, and a servant {is} free from his master.

title: Job 3:20
content: 20 Why is light given to the miserable, and life to the bitter in soul,

title: Job 3:21
content: 21 the ones longing for death, but {it is} not to them, and they dig for it more than for hidden treasure,

title: Job 3:22
content: 22 the ones rejoicing unto gladness, and they celebrate when they find a grave,

title: Job 3:23
content: 23 to a man whose way is hidden, and God has hedged around him?

title: Job 3:24
content: 24 For my sighing comes before my food, my groaning flows out like waters.

title: Job 3:25
content: 25 For I feared a fear and it has arrived with me; what I dreaded has come to me.

title: Job 3:26
content: 26 I have not relaxed, and I have not reposed, and I have not rested, but trouble comes.”

title: Job 4:1
content: 1 And Eliphaz the Temanite answered and said,

title: Job 4:2
content: 2 If a word is tried with you, will you tire? But to refrain from a word, who is able?

title: Job 4:3
content: 3 Behold, you have instructed many, you have strengthened weak hands.

title: Job 4:4
content: 4 Your words have upheld the one stumbling, and buckling knees you have strengthened.

title: Job 4:5
content: 5 But now it comes to you and you tire; it touches you and you panic.

title: Job 4:6
content: 6 {Is} not your fear your confidence, your hope, even the integrity of your ways?

title: Job 4:7
content: 7 Remember, now: Who, he {being} innocent, has perished? And when were the righteous destroyed?

title: Job 4:8
content: 8 According to what I have seen, the ones plowing misery and sowing trouble reap it.

title: Job 4:9
content: 9 By the breath of God they perish, and by the blast of his nose they cease {to be}.

title: Job 4:10
content: 10 The roar of the lion! The voice of the fierce lion! But the teeth of the young lions are broken.

title: Job 4:11
content: 11 The strong lion perishes for lack of prey, and the cubs of the lioness are scattered.

title: Job 4:12
content: 12 Now a word was confided to me, and my ear received a whisper of it.

title: Job 4:13
content: 13 In troubling thoughts from visions of the night, in the falling of deep sleep upon men,

title: Job 4:14
content: 14 fear happened to me, and trembling, and it frightened all my bones.

title: Job 4:15
content: 15 And a spirit was gliding before my face; the hair of my flesh was bristling.

title: Job 4:16
content: 16 It was standing still, but I was not recognizing its appearance. An image {was} in front of my eyes. {There was} silence, then I heard a voice:

title: Job 4:17
content: 17 ‘Will a man be more righteous than God? If a man will be more pure than his Maker?’

title: Job 4:18
content: 18 Behold, he does not trust in his servants, and he charges his angels with folly.

title: Job 4:19
content: 19 How much less dwellers in houses of clay that {have} their foundation in the dust! They crumble them before a moth!

title: Job 4:20
content: 20 From morning to evening they are destroyed; they perish forever without {anyone} noticing.

title: Job 4:21
content: 21 Is not their tent cord pulled up away from them? They will die, and not in wisdom.

title: Job 5:1
content: 1 Call out now; is there one answering you? To which of the holy ones will you turn?

title: Job 5:2
content: 2 For indignation kills the foolish, and resentment kills the one being simple.

title: Job 5:3
content: 3 I myself have seen the foolish taking root, but right away I cursed his abode.

title: Job 5:4
content: 4 His children are far from safety, and they are crushed at the gate, and {there is} none rescuing {them},

title: Job 5:5
content: 5 whose harvest the hungry one devours; they even take it from among the thorns, and the thirsty ones pant for their wealth.

title: Job 5:6
content: 6 For misery does not come out from the dust, and trouble does not sprout from the ground.

title: Job 5:7
content: 7 For man is born to trouble, and sons of the flame soar to fly.

title: Job 5:8
content: 8 But I myself would seek for God, and to God I would commit my cause,

title: Job 5:9
content: 9 the one doing great {things} and {there is} no searching, marvelous {things} until {there is} no number,

title: Job 5:10
content: 10 the one giving rain on the face of the earth and sending waters on the face of the fields,

title: Job 5:11
content: 11 setting the humble on high, and the ones mourning are high in safety,

title: Job 5:12
content: 12 frustrating the plans of the crafty, and their hands do not accomplish an initiative,

title: Job 5:13
content: 13 catching the cunning in their craftiness, and the plan of the ones being deceptive is hastened.

title: Job 5:14
content: 14 They encounter darkness by day, and they grope at midday as at night.

title: Job 5:15
content: 15 But he saves the poor from the sword in their mouths and from the hand of the mighty.

title: Job 5:16
content: 16 And hope is to the poor, and injustice shuts her mouth.

title: Job 5:17
content: 17 Behold, blessed is the man God corrects, and the chastening of the Almighty do not despise.

title: Job 5:18
content: 18 For he injures and binds up, he wounds and his hands heal.

title: Job 5:19
content: 19 In six troubles he will rescue you, and in seven, harm will not touch you.

title: Job 5:20
content: 20 In famine he will redeem you from death, and in war, from the hands of the sword.

title: Job 5:21
content: 21 From the scourge of the tongue you will be hidden, and you will not fear destruction when it comes.

title: Job 5:22
content: 22 You will laugh at destruction and at famine, and you will not fear the beast of the earth.

title: Job 5:23
content: 23 For with the stones of the field {will be} your covenant, and the beast of the field will be made peaceable to you.

title: Job 5:24
content: 24 You will know that your tent {is in} peace; you will visit your sheepfold and you will not miss {anything}.

title: Job 5:25
content: 25 And you will know that your seed {will be} great and your offspring, like the grass of the earth.

title: Job 5:26
content: 26 You will come to the grave in old age, like the lifting of a stack of grain in its time.

title: Job 5:27
content: 27 Behold this: We have examined it, thus it {is}; listen to it and know {it} for yourself.”

title: Job 6:1
content: 1 And Job answered and said,

title: Job 6:2
content: 2 “If only my anguish, being weighed, were weighed, and my calamity lay in the balances together {with it}!

title: Job 6:3
content: 3 For now it would be heavier than the sand of the seas; therefore my words raved.

title: Job 6:4
content: 4 For the arrows of the Almighty are in me, whose poison my spirit is drinking; the terrors of God array themselves against me.

title: Job 6:5
content: 5 Does a wild donkey bray over grass? If an ox bellows over its fodder?

title: Job 6:6
content: 6 Will the unsavory be eaten without salt? If there is taste in the white of an egg?

title: Job 6:7
content: 7 My soul has refused to touch; they {are} like disease {in} my food.

title: Job 6:8
content: 8 Who will grant that my request may come? And may God grant my longing

title: Job 6:9
content: 9 and may God be willing and may he crush me, may he loose his hand and cut me off!

title: Job 6:10
content: 10 Yet may it still be my consolation— indeed, let me exult in pain, may he not spare— that I have not concealed the sayings of the Holy One.

title: Job 6:11
content: 11 What {is} my strength, that I should wait? And what {is} my end, that I should prolong my life?

title: Job 6:12
content: 12 If my strength {is} the strength of stones? If my flesh {is} bronze?

title: Job 6:13
content: 13 If my help {is} not in me, and initiative has been taken away from me?

title: Job 6:14
content: 14 To the despairing, covenant faithfulness from his friend, and the fear of the Almighty he forsakes.

title: Job 6:15
content: 15 My brothers have dealt treacherously like a wadi, like a channel of wadis they pass away,

title: Job 6:16
content: 16 the ones being dark from ice over it, it hides itself with snow.

title: Job 6:17
content: 17 In the time they dry up, they are annihilated; in their being hot, they are exterminated from their place.

title: Job 6:18
content: 18 Caravans turn themselves aside from their way; they go up into wasteland and they perish.

title: Job 6:19
content: 19 Caravans from Tema looked; processions of Sheba hoped in them.

title: Job 6:20
content: 20 They were ashamed, because they had been confident; they went as far as it and they were confounded.

title: Job 6:21
content: 21 For now you are nothing; you see a terror and you fear.

title: Job 6:22
content: 22 {Is it} that I said, ‘Give me {something}’? Or, ‘Make a gift to me from your wealth’?

title: Job 6:23
content: 23 Or, ‘Save me from the hand of the enemy’? Or, ‘From the hand of the oppressors rescue me’?

title: Job 6:24
content: 24 Teach me, and I will be silent, and how I have strayed, make me understand.

title: Job 6:25
content: 25 How words of uprightness are forceful! But what does correcting from you correct?

title: Job 6:26
content: 26 Do you think to correct my words, and to the wind the words of one despairing?

title: Job 6:27
content: 27 Indeed, you cast {lots} for the fatherless, and you haggle over your friend.

title: Job 6:28
content: 28 But now, be willing, look at me, and if I would lie to your faces!

title: Job 6:29
content: 29 Please turn, let injustice not be; yes, turn, my righteousness {is} yet in it.

title: Job 6:30
content: 30 Is there injustice on my tongue? If my mouth does not discern iniquity?

title: Job 7:1
content: 1 {Is} not hardship to a man on earth? And {are not} his days like the days of a hireling?

title: Job 7:2
content: 2 As a slave longs for shade, and as a hireling awaits his wages,

title: Job 7:3
content: 3 so I have been caused to inherit months of futility, and they have appointed nights of trouble to me.

title: Job 7:4
content: 4 When I lie down, I say, ‘When will I get up?’ But the night extends, and I am full of tossings until dawn.

title: Job 7:5
content: 5 My flesh wears the worm and the clod of dust; my skin breaks and festers.

title: Job 7:6
content: 6 My days are swifter than a shuttle, and they end without hope.

title: Job 7:7
content: 7 Remember that my life {is} a breath; my eye will not return to see good.

title: Job 7:8
content: 8 The eye of the one seeing me will not regard me; your eyes {will be} on me, but I will not exist.

title: Job 7:9
content: 9 A cloud disappears and goes away; so the one descending to Sheol does not ascend.

title: Job 7:10
content: 10 He will not return again to his house, and his place will not know him again.

title: Job 7:11
content: 11 Therefore I will not restrain my mouth; I will speak in the distress of my spirit; I will complain in the bitterness of my soul.

title: Job 7:12
content: 12 {Am} I the sea or the sea monster, that you will set a guard over me?

title: Job 7:13
content: 13 When I say, ‘My couch will comfort me, my bed will take away my complaint,’

title: Job 7:14
content: 14 then you scare me with dreams and you terrify me through visions,

title: Job 7:15
content: 15 and my soul chooses strangling, death, rather than my bones.

title: Job 7:16
content: 16 I loathe; I will not live forever. Cease from me, for my days {are} vapor.

title: Job 7:17
content: 17 What is man, that you will magnify him and that you will set your heart on him,

title: Job 7:18
content: 18 and you will visit him in the mornings and you will test him in the moments?

title: Job 7:19
content: 19 For how long will you not look away from me? Will you not slacken until I swallow my saliva?

title: Job 7:20
content: 20 {If} I have sinned, what have I done to you, the one watching man? Why have you made me a target for you? Indeed, am I a burden to myself?

title: Job 7:21
content: 21 Why will you not pardon my transgression and take away my iniquity? For now I will lie down in the dust, and you will seek me diligently, but I will not exist.”

title: Job 8:1
content: 1 And Bildad the Shuhite answered and said,

title: Job 8:2
content: 2 “Until when will you say these things, and the words of your mouth {be} a mighty wind?

title: Job 8:3
content: 3 Does God pervert justice? Or does the Almighty pervert righteousness?

title: Job 8:4
content: 4 If your children sinned against him, then he put them in the hand of their sins.

title: Job 8:5
content: 5 If you seek diligently for God, and to the Almighty you appeal,

title: Job 8:6
content: 6 if you {are} pure and upright, surely now he will rouse himself for you and restore the habitation of your righteousness.

title: Job 8:7
content: 7 Though your beginning was small, yet your end will increase greatly.

title: Job 8:8
content: 8 For inquire now of the former generations and consider the finding of their fathers.

title: Job 8:9
content: 9 For we {are} of yesterday and we do not know, for our days on earth {are} a shadow.

title: Job 8:10
content: 10 Will they not teach you? They will speak to you, and from their hearts they will bring forth words.

title: Job 8:11
content: 11 Does papyrus grow without a marsh? Does a reed grow without waters?

title: Job 8:12
content: 12 It {is} still in its greenness, it is not cut down, but it withers before any {other} plant.

title: Job 8:13
content: 13 Thus {are} the paths of all the ones forgetting God, and the hope of the godless will perish,

title: Job 8:14
content: 14 whose confidence snaps and whose trust {is} the house of a spider.

title: Job 8:15
content: 15 He leans himself against his house and it does not stand; he takes hold of it, but it does not arise.

title: Job 8:16
content: 16 It {is} lush to the face of the sun, and its shoots go out over its garden.

title: Job 8:17
content: 17 Its roots are wrapped around a heap; it looks for a house of rocks.

title: Job 8:18
content: 18 When one destroys it from its place, then it will deny him, ‘I did not see you.’

title: Job 8:19
content: 19 Behold, this is the joy of his way, and from the dust other {plants} will sprout.

title: Job 8:20
content: 20 Behold, God will not reject the innocent, but he will not hold the hand of evildoers.

title: Job 8:21
content: 21 He will yet fill your mouth with laughter, your lips with shouting.

title: Job 8:22
content: 22 The ones hating you will wear shame, and the tent of the wicked will not exist.”

title: Job 9:1
content: 1 And Job answered and said,

title: Job 9:2
content: 2 “I know truly that {this is} so. But how will a man be righteous with God?

title: Job 9:3
content: 3 If he desires to contend with him, he will not answer him one from a thousand.

title: Job 9:4
content: 4 {He is} wise in heart and mighty in strength. Who has hardened himself against him and been whole?—

title: Job 9:5
content: 5 the one removing mountains and they do not know, who in his nose overturns them;

title: Job 9:6
content: 6 the one shaking the earth from its place and causing its pillars to tremble;

title: Job 9:7
content: 7 the one speaking to the sun and it does not rise, and upon the stars he seals;

title: Job 9:8
content: 8 stretching out the heavens by himself and treading on the waves of the sea;

title: Job 9:9
content: 9 making the Bear, Orion, the Pleiades, and the chambers of the south;

title: Job 9:10
content: 10 doing great {things} until there is no searching and distinguished {things} until there is no number.

title: Job 9:11
content: 11 Behold, he goes by me, but I do not see, and he passes, but I do not perceive him.

title: Job 9:12
content: 12 If he takes away, who will turn him back? Who will say to him, ‘What are you doing?’

title: Job 9:13
content: 13 God will not turn aside his nose; the helpers of Rahab bow beneath him.

title: Job 9:14
content: 14 Indeed that I will answer him, choose words with him!—

title: Job 9:15
content: 15 whom, if I were righteous, I would not answer; I would plead to my judge for mercy.

title: Job 9:16
content: 16 If I called and he answered me, I would not believe that he was giving ear to my voice,

title: Job 9:17
content: 17 who would break me with a tempest and multiply my wounds for nothing.

title: Job 9:18
content: 18 He does not allow me to cause my breath to return, for he fills me with bitterness.

title: Job 9:19
content: 19 If to strength, behold, {he is} mighty! And if to justice, who will summon him?

title: Job 9:20
content: 20 If I were righteous, my mouth would condemn me; {if} I {were} blameless, yet it would convict me.

title: Job 9:21
content: 21 I {am} blameless. I do not know my soul; I loathe my life.

title: Job 9:22
content: 22 It {is} one; therefore I have said, ‘The blameless and the wicked, he is destroying.’

title: Job 9:23
content: 23 When a scourge suddenly kills, he mocks the despair of the innocent {ones}.

title: Job 9:24
content: 24 The earth is given into the hand of the wicked. He covers the faces of its judges. If not, then who {is} it?

title: Job 9:25
content: 25 And my days are swifter than a runner, they flee. They do not see good.

title: Job 9:26
content: 26 They glide with boats of papyrus, as an eagle pounces on food.

title: Job 9:27
content: 27 If I said, ‘Let me forget my complaint, let me change my face, let me be cheerful,’

title: Job 9:28
content: 28 I would fear all my sorrows; I know that you would not acquit me.

title: Job 9:29
content: 29 I am wicked; why, then, would I toil in vain?

title: Job 9:30
content: 30 If I washed myself with water of snow and cleansed my hands with lye,

title: Job 9:31
content: 31 then you would plunge me into a ditch, and my clothes would abhor me.

title: Job 9:32
content: 32 For I would not be answering a man like me, we would {not} be coming together into judgment.

title: Job 9:33
content: 33 There would be no judge between us who would lay his hand upon the two of us,

title: Job 9:34
content: 34 who would turn from upon me his rod, and his terror, may it not frighten me.

title: Job 9:35
content: 35 I would speak and I would not fear him. But I {am} not thus with me.

title: Job 10:1
content: 1 My soul is weary of my life; I will abandon my complaint upon myself; I will speak in the bitterness of my soul.

title: Job 10:2
content: 2 I will say to God, ‘Do not condemn me; cause me to know for what you are accusing me.

title: Job 40:1
